qas.question: Where do unstressed vowels reduce to three?
What is the exception to this reduction?

context: In <a0_0>Eastern Catalan<a0_0/> (except <a1_0>Majorcan<a1_0/>), unstressed vowels reduce to three: /a e ɛ/ > [ə]; /o ɔ u/ > [u]; <a2_0>/i/<a2_0/> remains distinct. There are a few instances of unreduced [e], [o] in some words. Alguerese has lowered [ə] to [a].
